trans-unit.source: Management REST API Reference
trans-unit.target: Management REST API Reference

trans-unit.source: Azure Search Management REST API
trans-unit.target: Azure Search Management REST API

trans-unit.source: The Azure Search Service Management REST API provides programmatic access to much of the functionality available through the portal, allowing administrators to automate the following operations:
trans-unit.target: The Azure Search Service Management REST API provides programmatic access to much of the functionality available through the portal, allowing administrators to automate the following operations:

trans-unit.source: Create or delete an Azure Search service.
trans-unit.target: Create or delete an Azure Search service.

trans-unit.source: Create, regenerate, or retrieve <codeInline>api-keys</codeInline> to automate routine changes to the administrative keys used for authenticating data operations.
trans-unit.target: Create, regenerate, or retrieve <codeInline>api-keys</codeInline> to automate routine changes to the administrative keys used for authenticating data operations.

trans-unit.source: Adjust the scale of an Azure Search service in response to changes in query volume or storage requirements.
trans-unit.target: Adjust the scale of an Azure Search service in response to changes in query volume or storage requirements.

trans-unit.source: To fully administer your service programmatically, you will need two APIs: the Management REST API of Azure Search, plus the common <externalLink><linkText>Azure Resource Manager REST API</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790568.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: To fully administer your service programmatically, you will need two APIs: the Management REST API of Azure Search, plus the common <externalLink><linkText>Azure Resource Manager REST API</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790568.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The Resource Manager API is used for general purpose operations that are not service specific, such as querying subscription data, listing geo-locations, and so forth.
trans-unit.target: The Resource Manager API is used for general purpose operations that are not service specific, such as querying subscription data, listing geo-locations, and so forth.

trans-unit.source: To create and manage Azure Search services in your subscription, make sure your HTTP request includes the Resource Manager endpoint, subscription ID, provider (in this case, Azure Search), and the Search service-specific operation.
trans-unit.target: To create and manage Azure Search services in your subscription, make sure your HTTP request includes the Resource Manager endpoint, subscription ID, provider (in this case, Azure Search), and the Search service-specific operation.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>Get started with Azure Search Management REST API</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=516968</linkUri></externalLink> is a walkthrough of sample code that demonstrates application configuration and service management operations.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>Get started with Azure Search Management REST API</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=516968</linkUri></externalLink> is a walkthrough of sample code that demonstrates application configuration and service management operations.

trans-unit.source: The sample application issues requests to the Azure Resource Manager API as well as the service management API for Azure Search, giving you an idea of how to piece together a cohesive application that draws on both APIs.
trans-unit.target: The sample application issues requests to the Azure Resource Manager API as well as the service management API for Azure Search, giving you an idea of how to piece together a cohesive application that draws on both APIs.

trans-unit.source: Endpoint
trans-unit.target: Endpoint

trans-unit.source: The endpoint for service administration operations is the URL of Azure Resource Manager: <codeInline>https://management.azure.com</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The endpoint for service administration operations is the URL of Azure Resource Manager: <codeInline>https://management.azure.com</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Note that all management API calls must include the subscription ID.
trans-unit.target: Note that all management API calls must include the subscription ID.

trans-unit.source: Version
trans-unit.target: Version

trans-unit.source: The current version of the Management REST API is <codeInline>2015-02-28</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The current version of the Management REST API is <codeInline>2015-02-28</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: The previous version, <codeInline>2014-07-31-Preview</codeInline>, is deprecated.
trans-unit.target: The previous version, <codeInline>2014-07-31-Preview</codeInline>, is deprecated.

trans-unit.source: Although it will continue to work for the next several months, we encourage you to transition to the new version as soon as possible.
trans-unit.target: Although it will continue to work for the next several months, we encourage you to transition to the new version as soon as possible.

trans-unit.source: Authentication and Access Control
trans-unit.target: Authentication and Access Control

trans-unit.source: The Azure Search Management REST API is an extension of the Azure Resource Manager and shares its dependencies.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Search Management REST API is an extension of the Azure Resource Manager and shares its dependencies.

trans-unit.source: As such, Active Directory is a prerequisite to service administration of Azure Search.
trans-unit.target: As such, Active Directory is a prerequisite to service administration of Azure Search.

trans-unit.source: All administrative requests from client code must be authenticated using Azure Active Directory before the request reaches the resource manager.
trans-unit.target: All administrative requests from client code must be authenticated using Azure Active Directory before the request reaches the resource manager.

trans-unit.source: Note that if your application code handles <newTerm>service administration operations</newTerm> as well as <newTerm>data operations</newTerm> on search indexes or documents, you'll be using two authentication approaches for each of the Azure Search service APIs:
trans-unit.target: Note that if your application code handles <newTerm>service administration operations</newTerm> as well as <newTerm>data operations</newTerm> on search indexes or documents, you'll be using two authentication approaches for each of the Azure Search service APIs:

trans-unit.source: Service and key administration, due to the dependency on Resource Manager, relies on Active Directory for authentication.
trans-unit.target: Service and key administration, due to the dependency on Resource Manager, relies on Active Directory for authentication.

trans-unit.source: Data requests against the Azure Search service endpoint, such as <link xlink:href="ecafed05-c746-4d9e-ac8e-653066e909b5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Index (Azure Search API)</link> or <link xlink:href="716ef056-adf4-4b16-85b8-2cb777bc8458" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Search Documents (Azure Search API)</link>, use an <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> in the request header.
trans-unit.target: Data requests against the Azure Search service endpoint, such as <link xlink:href="ecafed05-c746-4d9e-ac8e-653066e909b5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Index (Azure Search API)</link> or <link xlink:href="716ef056-adf4-4b16-85b8-2cb777bc8458" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Search Documents (Azure Search API)</link>, use an <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> in the request header.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="b298ac63-7b92-48cd-afe2-828538c47ca9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Search Service REST API</link> for information about authenticating a data request.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="b298ac63-7b92-48cd-afe2-828538c47ca9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Search Service REST API</link> for information about authenticating a data request.

trans-unit.source: The sample application documented in <externalLink><linkText>Get started with Azure Search Management REST API</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=516968</linkUri></externalLink> demonstrates the authentication techniques for each type of operation.
trans-unit.target: The sample application documented in <externalLink><linkText>Get started with Azure Search Management REST API</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=516968</linkUri></externalLink> demonstrates the authentication techniques for each type of operation.

trans-unit.source: Instructions for configuring a client application to use Active Directory are included in the getting started.
trans-unit.target: Instructions for configuring a client application to use Active Directory are included in the getting started.

trans-unit.source: The sample application can be found at <externalLink><linkText>Azure Search Management API Demo</linkText><linkUri>https://azuresearchmgmtapi.codeplex.com/</linkUri></externalLink> on Codeplex.
trans-unit.target: The sample application can be found at <externalLink><linkText>Azure Search Management API Demo</linkText><linkUri>https://azuresearchmgmtapi.codeplex.com/</linkUri></externalLink> on Codeplex.

trans-unit.source: Access control for Azure Resource Manager uses the built-in Owner, Contributor, and Reader roles.
trans-unit.target: Access control for Azure Resource Manager uses the built-in Owner, Contributor, and Reader roles.

trans-unit.source: By default, all service administrators are members of the Owner role.
trans-unit.target: By default, all service administrators are members of the Owner role.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <externalLink><linkText>Role-based access control in the Azure portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/role-based-access-control-configure/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <externalLink><linkText>Role-based access control in the Azure portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/role-based-access-control-configure/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.target: Summary of operations

trans-unit.target: Allowable service administration operations include the following:
